EmailTemplate.name: WBN-2018-08-22 Self-Managing Kubernetes-as-a-Service.ES-2018-08-21 Self-Managing
EmailTemplate.subject: [Last Chance] Webinar: Turbonomic for Amazon EKS, Azure AKS, Google GKE, and Pivotal PKS
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://turbonomic.com/resources/self-managing-kubernetes-as-a-service/]]> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=there}},
Kubernetes-as-a-Service offerings are popping up everywhere now that organizations are bought in and need a way to more quickly build services and container deployments. Join us on August 22, 2018, at 11am ET <[[https://turbonomic.com/resources/self-managing-kubernetes-as-a-service/]]> as we discuss:
- What is KaaS?
- Cloud KaaS Considerations—think portability, interoperability, and extensibility
- KaaS Capabilities Comparisons—because everyone loves a matrix
- Early Business Differentiators We’re Seeing Across Cloud KaaSes
- What KaaS Is Not
- And of course, we’ll demo self-managing Kubernetes-as-a-Service, soon to be available for EKS, AKS, GKE, and PKS
<[[https://turbonomic.com/resources/self-managing-kubernetes-as-a-service/]]>
Turbonomic enables these deployments to continuously self-manage, freeing Devops and Operator teams to focus on applications and the business—not resource optimization. Whether you’re just starting your Kubernetes journey or all-in KaaS, there’s something for you.
We hope to see you there!
Regards, Team Turbonomic
